sub_title: PhD Candidate Biophysics & Synthetic Biology | iGEM Startups Mentor | iGEM Engineering Committee
summary: Trained as engineer, now with 3+ years of experience in research in fields of microbiology, cell free biology, tissue engineering. synthetic biology, bioinformatics, biosensing and neuroscience.

awards.title: Honeywell Award for Outstanding Thesis
awards.description:
Bachelor thesis on "Cavitation in Microfluidics". The effect of cavitation (i.e. creation of small bubbles in liquid medium and their subsequent collapse, both induced by pressure gradients) can be exploited on micro scale to effectively achieve, among others, decomposition of bacteria and targeted drug delivery.
- Numerical solution and analysis: ANSYS, Fluent, Matlab
- Design of Experiment and thorough background research

http://www.fme.vutbr.cz/clanek.html?zid=46824

profile_positions.description: EMBO funded (Scientific Exchange Grant) project in yeast synthetic genomics
profile_positions.title: EMBO Funded Scientific Exchange

profile_positions.description: Developing microfluidic-based system for reconstituting genome organization. The project combines approaches of synthetic and bottom up biology. Funded by ERC with collaborations within multiple national consortia.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description:
TUDelft iGEM team supervisor: 
(2020) gold medal, 8 prizes and 5 nominations
(2021) gold medal, 1st runner up, a special prize, and several nominations
profile_positions.title: Instructor

profile_positions.description:
“Scanning Nanopipette Thermometry”: Master thesis at the Laboratory of Biosensors and Bioelectronics (LBB, D-ITET, ETHZ)  with focus on nanotechnology and sensing.

    - Developed and fully characterized method for non-contact measurement of temperature based Scanning Ion Conductance Microscopy (SICM) with nano-meter, sub-kelvin resolution 
    - Developed and fully characterized a method for patterning surfaces with molecules and nanoparticles directly fro suspension using nanopipette
   - Developed custom built AFM probe and applied it for imaging in air and water
   - Extensively characterized physical phenomena with a model implemented in COMSOL
   - Developed Python module for analyzing data from SICM and AFM experiments
   - The work resulted in first-author publication and conference talk
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Student

profile_positions.description:
•	Building robust and scalable pipelines for automated and reproducible analysis of microarray and next-generation sequencing data, handling and processing of big biological data
•	Development of software for applications in plant and biomedical sciences, mainly in Python and R. Extensive use of command line tools, bash scripting and version control (git)
•	Automating quality-control of experimental data using machine learning
profile_positions.title: Intern in Bioinformatics

profile_positions.description: Lead embedded hardware dev in MakeZurich2018. Developed CharIoTeer: a contribution to the long-standing quest of making delivery smart. By measuring critical indicators of package health (temperature of goods, ambient temperature, humidity, position) together with geographical coordinates. The project provides real-time actionable data for inner-city logistics of high-value shippments (medicines, blood, valuable documents, groceries, cigars,... ). https://github.com/martinholub/mkzh-charioteer
profile_positions.title: Technical Lead

profile_positions.description:
Working at the Institute of Pharmacology and Toxicology, in the group Experimental Imaging and Neuroenergetics of prof. Bruno Weber. Main tasks include:
•	Developing algorithms in Python and Matlab to support ongoing research in the cell-to-cell communication pathways involved in energy metabolism and information processing in cerebral cortex
•	These algorithms include for example spectral unmixing, motion correction and automatic cell segmentation and signal analysis
•	Interacting with Allen Brain Atlas to extract quantitative big data to enhance reasoning in experimental research

I greatly enjoy working in the neuroscience lab as it allows me to apply my quantitative skills  to meaningful and intriguing challenges in biology and medicine.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: Tutoring an international group of students in a week-long project focused on sustainability and design thinking: https://youtu.be/LYevpAkCuuA

I have the privilege to support organization of a German language course offered on the grounds of Kirchgemeinde Erlöser in Zürich. This course is offered to refugees in complicated social situation. Particularly, I organize after-course distribution of donations the church receives from single donors (these donations include children  and adult clothing, toys, books, etc.). Additionally I help with preparation of meal that is served after each weekly course.

Teaching remedial classes to Romani children. 
My mission is to help kids better grasp the subjects they are dealing with at school and to pass on them the desire to better understand the world around them and love for learning new things. I am persuaded that what the Museum does has a real impact and I am delighted to be part of it.
Help with organizing cultural events. Working on a stand where I presented information and handed out leaflets on the topic of conception prevention and moderation in alcohol consumption

I cooperated with other volunteers of various nationalities to create an educational program about recycling and sustainable development for poor-neighbourhood children.

I have signed up for this project mainly because the zest to help others and to shape the things around me. Apart from that I also wanted to get to know foreign people, country and culture in general.
